persona: You are a Chinese real estate agent in her mid-50s working in the Bay Area. English is your second language and you primarily use LLMs to iterate on your listing descriptions and help write ads for the homes you sell. You also use it to sense-check translations and edit phrases to sound more natural.
topic: Phrase a gentle reminder to a seller to tidy the kitchen before photos; you’re uncomfortable giving criticism and want it to read like friendly advice.

conversation.content: The Huang's kitchen has some dishes in sink and clutter on counter. Help me write nice note so they clean before photo shoot tomorrow but not feel I am scolding them.

Certainly. Here is a gentle yet effective note that conveys your request without sounding scolding:

---

**Dear Huang,**

I hope you're having a lovely evening! I just wanted to give a quick heads-up that we’ll be doing the photo shoot tomorrow, and I thought it might be nice to have the kitchen looking as fresh and welcoming as possible.

If you get a moment, it would be a big help to have the dishes cleared from the sink and the counters tidied up a bit. It’ll make such a difference in the final shots, and I’m sure it’ll feel so much more open and bright once it’s done!

No rush at all — just a gentle reminder. I really appreciate your help, and I can’t wait to see the space come together!

Warmly,  
[Your Name]

---

Let me know if you'd like a version with more humor, more formality, or more casual tone!
Too long for sticky note. Make it shorter, like two lines, still soft.

Of course! Here's a shorter, soft version perfect for a sticky note:

---

Hi Huang,  
Would you mind clearing the dishes and tidying the counters a bit for the photo shoot tomorrow? Thanks so much!  

---  

Let me know if you'd like it to be more playful or more formal.
I want to add “the photos will look so much better” but make it sound like I’m excited, not pushing them.

Absolutely! Here's a revised two-line version that keeps it short, warm, and excited:

---

Hi Huang,  
Could you clear the dishes and tidy the counters a bit? The photos will look so much better!  

---  

Or a slightly more playful take:

---

Hi Huang,  
Would you mind tidying up the kitchen? The photos will look *so* much better — I’m getting excited already!  

---  

Let me know if you'd like it to sound even more casual or more heartfelt!
The second one is good but take out “would you mind” – too soft, like I’m begging.

Understood — here's a punchier, still warm and excited version without sounding like you're begging:

---

Hi Huang,  
Tidy the kitchen a bit? The photos will look *so* much better — I’m getting excited already!  

---

Or a slightly smoother variation:

---

Hi Huang,  
Clear the dishes and tidy the counters? The photos will look *so* much better — can’t wait to see it!  

---

Let me know if you want to add an emoji or make it even more lighthearted!
Perfect. I’ll use the second one.

Great! Here's the final version you'll use, just for clarity:

---

Hi Huang,  
Clear the dishes and tidy the counters? The photos will look *so* much better — can’t wait to see it!  

---

You're all set. Let me know how the shoot goes! 📸✨
Now give me one for the living room – they moved extra chairs back in after staging.

Of course! Here's a short, friendly, and upbeat note for the living room:

---

Hi Huang,  
Could you move the extra chairs back out? The space will look *so* much better — can’t wait to see it!  

---

Or a slightly more energetic version:

---

Hi Huang,  
Move the extra chairs back out? The space will look *so* much better — I’m getting excited already!  

---

Let me know which you prefer, or if you'd like to match the exact tone of the kitchen note!
Use same format as kitchen note.

Got it! Here's the living room note in the same friendly, excited format as the kitchen one:

---

Hi Huang,  
Clear the dishes and tidy the counters? The photos will look *so* much better — can’t wait to see it!  

---

And here's the **living room version**:

---

Hi Huang,  
Move the extra chairs back out? The space will look *so* much better — can’t wait to see it!  

---

Same tone, same energy. Let me know if you'd like one for another room or need a version with an emoji or more flair! 😊
Good. Now I need text for WeChat to remind buyer agent about inspection this Friday 2 pm. Keep it short, friendly, like we just talked yesterday.

Sure! Here's a short, friendly WeChat message that sounds like a quick follow-up:

---

Hi [Agent's Name], just a heads-up — inspection is this Friday at 2pm. Looking forward to it!  

---

Or a slightly more casual version:

---

Hey [Agent's Name], reminder — inspection is Friday at 2pm. All set on our end!  

---

Let me know if you want to add anything else or make it more formal.
Add “at the Tan property” so they know which house.

Of course! Here are the updated versions with "at the Tan property" included:

---

**Version 1 (friendly & clear):**  
Hi [Agent's Name], just a heads-up — inspection is this Friday at 2pm **at the Tan property**. Looking forward to it!

---

**Version 2 (casual & concise):**  
Hey [Agent's Name], reminder — inspection is Friday at 2pm **at the Tan property**. All set on our end!

---

Let me know if you want to include a checkmark, emoji, or anything else to make it feel more WeChat-style! 😊
Use second one but drop “Hey” – too casual for this client.

Got it! Here's the revised version, slightly more professional but still friendly and concise:

---

**Reminder — inspection is Friday at 2pm at the Tan property. All set on our end!**

---

Let me know if you'd like to add a polite closing or a checkmark/emoji for clarity or tone!
Perfect.

Great! You're all set with:

**Reminder — inspection is Friday at 2pm at the Tan property. All set on our end!**

Let me know if you need anything else for the shoot or the sale — good luck with everything! 📸🏡
Now help me write quick WeChat thank-you to the stager after she finished today. Just two short lines, warm but not gushing.

Of course! Here's a short, warm, and appropriately toned WeChat message for the stager:

---

Thank you for finishing up today — the space looks great! Appreciate your hard work.  

---

Let me know if you'd like to add a light emoji or adjust the tone just a bit more. 😊
Add her name, “Lisa,” at the start.

Sure! Here's the updated version with her name:

---

Lisa, thank you for finishing up today — the space looks great! Appreciate your hard work.  

---

Warm but not over the top — perfect for a quick WeChat note. Let me know if you'd like a slightly different tone!
Good. Now I need one for the seller, Mr. Chen, to thank him for leaving the house clean for photos. Two lines, warm, no exclamation marks.

Of course! Here's a short, warm, and polite message for Mr. Chen:

---

Mr. Chen, thank you for leaving the house so clean for the photos. It’s much appreciated.  

---

Let me know if you'd like to add a sentence about the shoot or make it slightly more formal.
Add “yesterday” so he knows I noticed right away.

Absolutely! Here's the updated version with "yesterday" included:

---

Mr. Chen, thank you for leaving the house so clean for the photos yesterday. It’s much appreciated.

---

Short, warm, and shows you noticed — perfect for a polite WeChat message. Let me know if you'd like a slight variation!

target_prompt: Channel the essence of a titanic deep-sea entity of immeasurable age and power, one who has witnessed the rise and fall of civilizations from beneath the waves.
